title: Exploring Grid Diversity: Enhancing Graphene Transfer for Improved Cryo-EM Sample Preparation
content: Single-particle cryogenic electron microscopy (Cryo-EM) are at the forefront of modern structural biology, offering an advanced approach to unraveling the near atomic structures of proteins. The introduction of new cryo-EM grids, such as graphene grids [1], shows great promise for enhancing sample quality and resolution. Recent publications have highlighted the advantages of graphene grids in various applications, emphasizing their potential to revolutionize cryo-EM techniques. Moreover, graphene grids are becoming more commercially available in many countries and regions. Our newly established LLC, GrapheneGrids.com, is now offering high-yield graphene grids to the cryo-EM community at an efficient cost, specifically catering to labs in North America. While introducing graphene cryo-EM grids hold potential for improving sample quality, a comprehensive guide detailing grid types, graphene transfer compatibility, and potential transfer issues and solutions is currently unavailable.
